thanks to your continued support every now and then i try to publish patterns that are free for everyone to enjoy as a way to permanently thank the knitting community for this opportunity thank you from the bottom of my heart for allowing me to live a full and happy life 2 knit free finished measurements sample i used the lightest color first and the 31 inches 78 cm circumference and 13¼ darkest last inches 33 cm long needles us 5 3 75 mm and us 8 5mm circular needles 24 60 cm long other notions stitch markers tapestry needle materials main yarn gauge 1 skein of rastita by malabrigo 100% merino 100g/310 yards or 310 yards 285 m of light 18 5 stitches and 27 row to 4 10 cm in dk or heavy sport weight yarn shown in the lace pattern on us 8 5 mm needles after colorway plomo blocking contrasting colors gauge is not crucial for this project however leftovers of fingering weight yarn in 6 changes might result in a different yardage different colors adding a total of approx 310 requirement yards 285 m i used different brands and textures and picked colors that formed an fade ombre or gradient progression you will need approx 15g 52 yards 47 m of each color you could also use any 6-mini-skein set or mini-skeins that different dyers offer you can pick any color combination and you don t need to make an ombre progression you can arrange them as you prefer in my tips for substituting i encourage you to find in your stash any materials that may work for this cowl it can be worked with multiple combination of yarn you like that gives you a similar gauge i used a strand of dk + 1 of fingering but you could also use 3 strands of fingering you can also use just 2 strands of fingering it will make a lighter and slightly smaller version 3 4 directions rounds 8 10 12 p1
